intro: Aniseia harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand's anise, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
